member.name: IMemAllocatorCallbackTemp.GetFreeCount

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetFreeCount method returns the number of free media samples. This number equals the total number of media samples minus the number of samples that are currently held by filters.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of free media samples.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IMemAllocatorCallbackTemp.SetNotify

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetNotify method sets or removes a callback on the allocator. The allocator calls the callback method whenever the allocator's method is called.

member.param: Pointer to the interface that will be used for the callback. The caller must implement the interface. Use the value NULL to remove the callback.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IMemAllocatorCallbackTemp interface enables a filter to receive a callback notification from an allocator whenever a sample is returned to the allocator's free list.
The use of this interface is deprecated.
